description: From Middle English redolent (first attested in 1400), from Old French redolent, from Latin redolentem, present participle of redoleō (“I emit a scent”), from red- + oleō (“I smell”).

adjectives.description: redolent (comparative more redolent, superlative most redolent)

entries.meaning: Fragrant or aromatic; having a sweet scent.
Having the smell of the article in question.
examples: His breath is already redolent of whiskey.
But forth from sweat-shops, tenement and prisonWailed minor protests, redolent with pain.
